DOC.brief_summary: Intraosseous vascular access can be used to effectively and safely deliver contrast dye for CT examination.
DOC.brief_title: Observational Study of CT Dye Administration Through the Intraosseous Vascular Access Route
DOC.detailed_description: intraosseous vascular access in the proximal humerus can be used to delivery contrast dye for CT examination.
DOC.criteria: Aged 18 years or older Has received intraosseous vascular access at the proximal humerus insertion site via EZIO as standard of care Requires CT examination with contrast media delivery via proximal humerus intraosseous catheter, as standard of care Cognitively and physically able to give written consent to participate in the study Fracture in target bone, or significant trauma to the site Excessive tissue and/or absence of adequate anatomical landmarks in target bone Infection in target area IO insertion in past 24 hours, prosthetic limb or joint or other significant orthopedic procedure in target bone Allergy to contrast media Imprisoned Pregnant Requires English language translation other than Spanish Has received IO access with an IO catheter other than the EZIO system
